alert.note: Alert for Butler; Muhlenberg; Ohio (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 26 at 6:50AM EDT until March 26 at 10:13PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Green River at Rochester affecting Muhlenberg, Ohio and Butler Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...High water caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Green River at Rochester. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 34.0 feet, Rochester Ferry stops operation. At 37.0 feet, Reeds and Rochester Ferries remain closed. KY 369 floods one mile north of Rochester. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 36.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 36.6 feet this afternoon. - Action stage is 34.0 feet. - Flood stage is 37.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding is possible and rivers are forecast to exceed bankfull. If you are in the advisory area remain alert to possible flooding, or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued later today.
